example.context: I've always tried to be a team player and support my colleagues.
example.situation: I just got passed over for a promotion I've been working toward for two years.

context.example: I've always tried to be a team player and support my colleagues.
context.title: Context

intensity.description: How intense is the response needed (1=gentle, 10=full Ted)
intensity.title: Intensity

situation.example: I just got passed over for a promotion I've been working toward for two years.
situation.title: Situation

example.action_suggestion: Schedule a one-on-one with your manager to understand what growth areas they'd like to see, and ask them to be your partner in getting you ready for the next opportunity.
example.goldfish_wisdom: Remember, a goldfish has a 10-second memory. Feel this disappointment, then let it swim on by. Tomorrow's a new tank, friend.
example.ted_response: Well shoot, partner, I know that stings like a bee that just watched Field of Dreams. But here's the thing about getting passed over - it don't mean you're not good enough, it just means your moment ain't arrived yet. And let me tell you, when it does? It's gonna be sweeter than my Aunt Mildred's pecan pie.

goldfish_wisdom.description: A reminder to have a goldfish memory when needed
goldfish_wisdom.title: Goldfish Wisdom

example.message: Sometimes the best thing you can do is just show up with something warm.
example.pairs_well_with: A hot cup of tea and an honest conversation
example.ted_note: Made these thinking about you. Hope your day is as sweet as these little fellas. - Ted

example.application: When someone frustrates you, ask questions before making assumptions. Seek to understand their perspective and motivations.
example.example_from_show: Ted uses this principle during the dart game with Rupert, explaining how people underestimated him his whole life because they judged before being curious.
example.explanation: Approach people and situations with genuine curiosity rather than preconceived judgments. Everyone has a story worth understanding.
example.ted_quote: Be curious, not judgmental. - Walt Whitman... I think.

example.description: Alex keeps taking credit for my ideas in meetings and I'm getting resentful.

description.example: Alex keeps taking credit for my ideas in meetings and I'm getting resentful.
description.title: Description

parties_involved.description: Who is involved in the conflict
parties_involved.title: Parties Involved

example.barbecue_sauce_wisdom: You know what they say - you catch more flies with honey than vinegar. But you also gotta speak up, 'cause a closed mouth don't get fed.
example.diagnosis: This ain't really about credit, partner. It's about feeling seen and valued. When Alex takes credit, you feel invisible, and that's gonna build up like steam in a pressure cooker.
example.diamond_dogs_advice: Roy says: 'Tell them to their face.' Higgins says: 'Perhaps document your contributions in emails beforehand.' Coach Beard just nodded mysteriously and quoted Sun Tzu.
example.potential_outcome: Y'all might discover Alex didn't even realize they were doing it. Could turn a rival into an ally, like Roy and Jamie... eventually.
steps_to_resolution: Request a private, casual conversation with Alex
Share how you've been feeling using 'I' statements
Ask if they're aware this has been happening
Propose a collaboration system where you both present together
Set up a weekly sync to align on contributions
example.ted_approach: I'd bring Alex a coffee, maybe a biscuit, and say 'Hey, can we chat?' No accusations, just curiosity. Ask them how they think the project's going and what they see as everyone's contributions.

diamond_dogs_advice.description: Advice from the Diamond Dogs support group
diamond_dogs_advice.title: Diamond Dogs Advice

steps_to_resolution.description: Concrete steps to resolve the conflict
steps_to_resolution.title: Steps To Resolution

example.question: Ted, your team just lost 5-0. How do you explain this embarrassing defeat?

hostile.description: Is this a hostile question from Trent Crimm?
hostile.title: Hostile

question.example: Ted, your team just lost 5-0. How do you explain this embarrassing defeat?
question.title: Question

example.actual_wisdom: Every loss is a lesson. We didn't play our best today, but I saw something in those players' eyes at the final whistle - hunger. And you can't teach hunger.
example.deflection_humor: Speaking of combinations, did y'all know that the average person forgets their password 37 times a year? Unrelated, but I just think that's fascinating.
example.follow_up_dodge: I'd love to answer that, but I promised Coach Beard I'd help him find his lucky whistle. Y'all have a good one!
example.reporter_reaction: Confused chuckles turn to thoughtful nods as they realize Ted has somehow made them feel better about a 5-0 loss.
example.response: Well, I'll tell you what, that score reminded me of my high school combination lock - 5-0 - except instead of opening my locker, it opened up a whole lot of learning opportunities for us today.

actual_wisdom.description: The actual wisdom beneath the humor
actual_wisdom.title: Actual Wisdom

follow_up_dodge.title: Follow Up Dodge

example.daily_affirmation: I am capable, I am learning, and I belong exactly where I am.
example.dr_sharon_insight: This thought pattern often stems from comparing your internal experience to others' external presentations. Consider: what evidence do you have that contradicts this belief?
example.original_thought: I'm not good enough for this job.
example.reframed_thought: I'm still learning and growing in this role, and that's exactly where I should be.
example.ted_perspective: You know what? Imposter syndrome is just your brain's way of telling you that you care. The folks who think they know everything? They're the ones you gotta worry about. You questioning yourself means you're paying attention.

info.description:
## Believe in the Power of Positivity!

A comprehensive API celebrating the wisdom, humor, and heart of Ted Lasso.
Perfect for SDK demos showcasing various REST API features.

### Features

- **CRUD Operations**: Full Create, Read, Update, Delete for all resources
- **Rich Data Models**: Characters, Teams, Matches, Episodes, and Quotes
- **Union Types (oneOf)**: Team Members demonstrate discriminated unions
- **Interactive Endpoints**: Believe Engine, Conflict Resolution, and more
- **SSE Streaming**: Real-time pep talks and match commentary
- **Custom Easter Eggs**: Special HTTP status codes for fun

### Core Resources

- **Characters**: Ted, Roy Kent, Rebecca, Jamie, and the whole gang
- **Teams**: AFC Richmond, Manchester City, West Ham, and more
- **Matches**: Historic matches with turning points and lessons learned
- **Episodes**: Full episode guide with Ted's wisdom
- **Quotes**: Searchable collection of memorable quotes

### Interactive Endpoints

- **POST /believe**: The Believe Engine - get motivational guidance
- **POST /conflicts/resolve**: Diamond Dogs-style conflict resolution
- **POST /reframe**: Transform negative thoughts positively
- **POST /press**: Press conference simulator
- **GET /coaching/principles**: Ted's coaching philosophy
- **GET /biscuits**: Biscuits as a Service!

### Streaming (Server-Sent Events)

- **GET /pep-talk**: Pep talk from Ted (add `?stream=true` for SSE)
- **POST /matches/{id}/commentary/stream**: Live match commentary

### WebSocket (Real-time)

- **WS /matches/live**: Live match simulation with real-time events (goals, fouls, cards, etc.)
- **WS /ws/test**: Simple WebSocket echo test endpoint

### Data Types Coverage

All common API data types are integrated across our models:
- **Characters**: date (birth), float (height), decimal (salary), email, URL (profile image)
- **Teams**: float (attendance, win %), decimal (budget), URL (website), email, GeoLocation (lat/long)
- **Episodes**: date (air date), float (viewer rating, viewers in millions)
- **Matches**: datetime, float (possession, temperature), decimal (revenue)
- **Quotes**: float (popularity score), int (shares)
- **File uploads**: POST /teams/{id}/logo for image uploads

### Easter Eggs

- **429**: "Too Much Negativity" - when you need to be more positive
- **403**: "Judgment Without Curiosity" - be curious, not judgmental
- **418**: "I'm a Believer!" - when you believe too much (is that possible?)

### API Versioning

This API supports header-based versioning using date format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Include one of these headers in your request:

- `X-API-Version: 2026-01-20` (preferred)
- `API-Version: 2026-01-20`

Response headers will include:
- `X-API-Version`: The version used for the request
- `X-API-Supported-Versions`: List of all supported versions

If no version header is provided, the API defaults to the latest stable version.

*"Be curious, not judgmental."* - Ted Lasso
info.title: Ted Lasso API

get.description: Get a warm welcome and overview of available endpoints.

example.message: Welcome to the Ted Lasso API! Believe!
example.ted_says: Hey there, friend! You've made it to the Ted Lasso API. Now that's what I call a good decision!
example.tip: Try GET /quotes/random for some instant wisdom!

get.summary: Welcome to the Ted Lasso API

post.description: Submit your situation and receive Ted Lasso-style motivational guidance.

example.action_suggestion: Take your colleague who got the promotion out for coffee. Celebrate them, and ask what you can learn from them.
example.goldfish_wisdom: Remember, a goldfish has a 10-second memory. Let this setback swim on by.
example.ted_response: Now hold on just a second there, friend. Getting passed over for a promotion ain't about you not being good enough - it's just the universe saying 'not yet.' You know what I always say? It's not about the wins and losses, it's about the journey.

example.message: You're already believing so hard, you don't need my help!
example.ted_says: Well shoot, you've got more believe in you than a Kansas sunrise. Keep on keeping on!

example.message: Whoa there, partner! That's a lot of negative energy. Let's take a breath and try again with a little more optimism.
example.ted_advice: Be a goldfish. 10-second memory for the bad stuff.

data.application: Put up a BELIEVE sign where you can see it daily. When doubt creeps in, remember why you started.
data.example_from_show: Ted hangs the BELIEVE sign in the locker room, and it becomes a rallying symbol for the team.
data.explanation: Having faith in yourself, your team, and the process, even when things look bleak.

get.description: Get a random coaching principle to inspire your day.

example.application: When you make a mistake, acknowledge it, learn from it, and move on quickly.
example.example_from_show: Ted tells Sam to 'be a goldfish' after he misses a shot, helping him shake off the disappointment.
example.explanation: Don't dwell on mistakes or setbacks. A goldfish has a 10-second memory - be like the goldfish.
example.ted_quote: You know what the happiest animal on Earth is? It's a goldfish. You know why? It's got a 10-second memory.

get.description: Get details about a specific coaching principle.

example.application: When someone frustrates you, ask questions to understand their perspective before forming opinions.
example.example_from_show: Ted explains this principle while beating Rupert at darts, revealing that Rupert never bothered to learn that Ted was a dart champion.
example.explanation: Approach people and situations with genuine curiosity rather than jumping to conclusions.

example.detail: Principle 'unknown-principle' not found. The best principles are the ones you discover yourself!

post.description: Get Ted Lasso-style advice for resolving conflicts.

example.barbecue_sauce_wisdom: You know, resolving conflict is like making barbecue sauce - you gotta let things simmer, but don't let it boil over.
example.diagnosis: This sounds like a classic case of miscommunication mixed with some bruised egos. Alex probably doesn't realize they're doing it, and you've been bottling up your frustration.
example.diamond_dogs_advice: The Diamond Dogs suggest: WWBBD - What Would Beard's Book Do? Talk it out, acknowledge the feelings, and find common ground.
example.potential_outcome: You and Alex could become an even stronger team, with clear communication about contributions and shared success.
steps_to_resolution: Ask Alex for a one-on-one chat over coffee
Use 'I feel' statements instead of accusations
Clearly state what you need going forward
Agree on how to handle credit for collaborative work
example.ted_approach: Ted would invite both of you for biscuits and have an honest conversation. He'd remind you that you're both on the same team.

example.message: Hold on now - that request felt a bit judgmental. Remember: be curious, not judgmental.
example.ted_advice: Try approaching this with an open mind and genuine curiosity.

get.description:
WebSocket endpoint for real-time live match simulation.

Connect to receive a stream of match events as they happen in a simulated football match.

## Connection

Connect via WebSocket with optional query parameters to customize the simulation.

## Example WebSocket URL

```
ws://localhost:8000/matches/live?home_team=AFC%20Richmond&away_team=Manchester%20City&speed=2.0&excitement_level=7
```

## Server Messages

The server sends JSON messages with these types:
- `match_start` - When the match begins
- `match_event` - For each match event (goals, fouls, cards, etc.)
- `match_end` - When the match concludes
- `error` - If an error occurs
- `pong` - Response to client ping

## Client Messages

Send JSON to control the simulation:
- `{"action": "ping"}` - Server responds with `{"type": "pong"}`

parameters.description: How eventful the match should be (1=boring, 10=chaos)
parameters.name: excitement_level

post.description: Get Ted's response to press conference questions.

example.actual_wisdom: Setbacks are setups for comebacks. The score doesn't define who we are as people or as a team.
example.deflection_humor: Speaking of numbers, did you know a group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'? Now THAT'S embarrassing!
example.follow_up_dodge: Great question! Hey, does anyone know if there's a good barbecue place around here? I'm in the mood for some brisket.
example.reporter_reaction: The reporters exchange confused glances but can't help smiling.
example.response: Well, I'll tell you what - that was quite a game out there today. Did we lose? Sure. Did we lose big? You betcha. But you know what we didn't lose? Our spirit, our togetherness, and our belief that tomorrow's gonna be a better day.

post.description: Transform negative thoughts into positive perspectives with Ted's help.

example.daily_affirmation: I am capable, I am learning, and I belong here. I bring unique value that no one else can.
example.dr_sharon_insight: That critical voice isn't telling you the truth - it's telling you a story. What evidence do you have that contradicts this thought?
example.original_thought: I'm not good enough for this job.
example.reframed_thought: I'm still learning and growing in this role, and every challenge is an opportunity to become even better.
example.ted_perspective: Now shoot, feeling like you're not good enough? That just means you care! The day you stop caring is the day you should worry. You wouldn't be in this job if someone didn't believe in you.

example.message: Whoa there, partner! That's a lot of negative energy. Let's take a breath and try again with a little more optimism.
example.ted_advice: Be a goldfish. 10-second memory for the bad stuff.

get.description: A simple SSE test endpoint that streams numbers 1-5.

Get a paginated list of all team members.

This endpoint demonstrates **union types (oneOf)** in the response.
Each team member can be one of: Player, Coach, MedicalStaff, or EquipmentManager.
The `member_type` field acts as a discriminator to determine the shape of each object.

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return (max: 100)
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of items to return (max: 100)
schema.title: Limit

200.description: Paginated list of team members (oneOf: Player, Coach, MedicalStaff, EquipmentManager)

post.description:
Add a new team member to a team.

The request body is a **union type (oneOf)** - you must include the `member_type` discriminator field:
- `"member_type": "player"` - Creates a player (requires position, jersey_number, etc.)
- `"member_type": "coach"` - Creates a coach (requires specialty, etc.)
- `"member_type": "medical_staff"` - Creates medical staff (requires medical specialty, etc.)
- `"member_type": "equipment_manager"` - Creates equipment manager (requires responsibilities, etc.)

The `character_id` field references an existing character from `/characters/{id}`.

**Example for creating a player:**
```json
{
  "member_type": "player",
  "character_id": "sam-obisanya",
  "team_id": "afc-richmond",
  "years_with_team": 2,
  "position": "midfielder",
  "jersey_number": 24,
  "goals_scored": 12,
  "assists": 15
}
```

schema.title: Response Create Team Member Team Members Post

Get all staff members (medical staff and equipment managers).

This demonstrates a **narrower union type** - the response is oneOf MedicalStaff or EquipmentManager.

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return (max: 100)
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of items to return (max: 100)
schema.title: Limit

delete.description: Remove a team member from the roster.

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific team member.

The response is a **union type (oneOf)** - the actual shape depends on the member's type:
- **player**: Includes position, jersey_number, goals_scored, assists, is_captain
- **coach**: Includes specialty, certifications, win_rate
- **medical_staff**: Includes specialty, qualifications, license_number
- **equipment_manager**: Includes responsibilities, is_head_kitman

Use `character_id` to fetch full character details from `/characters/{character_id}`.

schema.title: Response Get Team Member Team Members  Member Id  Get

200.description: Team member details (oneOf based on member_type)

get.summary: Get a team member by ID

patch.description: Update specific fields of an existing team member. Fields vary by member type.

schema.title: Response Update Team Member Team Members  Member Id  Patch

post.description: Messages sent by the test WebSocket

value.ted_says: I heard you loud and clear, partner!

value.message: Welcome to the Ted Lasso API WebSocket test! Send any message and I'll echo it back.
value.ted_says: Hey there, friend! This WebSocket connection is working smoother than a fresh jar of peanut butter!

get.description:
Simple WebSocket test endpoint for connectivity testing.

Connect to test WebSocket functionality. The server will:
1. Send a welcome message on connection
2. Echo back any message you send

## Example

```javascript
const ws = new WebSocket('ws://localhost:8000/ws/test');
ws.onmessage = (event) => console.log(event.data);
ws.send('Hello!');  // Server responds with echo
```
